name: Person
description: The person object represents a real user in an organizational network environment.

uid.description: The unique identifier of the person.

categories.description: A list of logical classifications for the person. Used for asset and person correlation and categorization.

domain.description: The domain where the person is defined. For example: the LDAP or Active Directory domain.

end_time.name: End Date
end_time.description: The end or termination date of a person.

groups.description: The groups to which the person belongs.

location.description: The geographical location of the person's office.

org_unit.description: The name of the org unit to which the person belongs.

priority.description: The original priority assigned to the person.

priority_id.description: The normalized priority identifier assigned to the person. The priority is useful for calculating the urgency for alerts or incidents.

-1.name: Other
-1.description: The priority is not normalized. See the priority attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

start_time.name: Start Date
start_time.description: The start or hire date of a person.
